holidays.name: Chaos Never Dies Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to embracing the unpredictable and celebrating the beautiful chaos of life. Whether you're juggling schedules, dealing with unexpected surprises, or just reveling in the messiness of the universe, today is your day to shine!
holidays.origin: Emerging from internet culture and meme communities, Chaos Never Dies Day was popularized as a humorous reminder that no matter how much we plan, chaos is inevitable.
holidays.funFact: Chaos Never Dies Day is unofficially celebrated by refreshing traffic apps repeatedly because, yes, traffic chaos never dies!

holidays.name: Balloon Ascension Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the first manned balloon flight in 1783 by the Montgolfier brothers, marking humanity's first steps into the skies via hot air balloon.
holidays.origin: Celebrates the pioneering French hot air balloon flight on November 9, 1783, symbolizing human innovation and adventure.
holidays.funFact: The first hot air balloon flight passengers were a sheep, a duck, and a rooster to test the effects of altitude on living creatures!

holidays.name: Scrapple Day
holidays.description: A quirky food holiday honoring scrapple, a beloved mush of pork scraps and cornmeal that's a staple in Mid-Atlantic cuisine, especially in Pennsylvania.
holidays.origin: Rooted in Pennsylvania Dutch culinary traditions, Scrapple Day celebrates this heritage food which turns humble leftovers into a crispy breakfast delight.
holidays.funFact: Scrapple was originally created to prevent waste and make use of every part of the pig ‚Äî a true 'nose-to-tail' meal!

holidays.name: Captain Crunch Day
holidays.description: A fun day for cereal lovers and nostalgic snackers alike to celebrate the iconic Captain Crunch cereal mascot and his colorful, crunchy crew.
holidays.origin: Coincides with the birthday of Captain Horatio Magellan Crunch, the animated mascot introduced in the 1960s to promote the sweetened corn and oat cereal.
holidays.funFact: Captain Crunch has four 'secret' cereals in his crew, including Crunch Berries and Peanut Butter Crunch, each with their unique fan base.

holidays.name: Sputnik Day
holidays.description: Marks the anniversary of the launch of Sputnik 1 in 1957, the first man-made satellite to orbit Earth, sparking the space age and global technological competition.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the Soviet Union's groundbreaking achievement that astonished the world and kick-started the space race.
holidays.funFact: Sputnik‚Äôs beep-beep transmissions were the first human-made radio signals from space ever picked up on Earth!
